title: Teenager jailed for sexually assaulting teenager after Snapchat spurn
text:
Aaron Irvine went to the house armed with a ‘rape kit’ (Picture: South Beds News Agency)

A teenage boy dressed up like an SAS soldier and went armed with a ‘rape kit’ to sexually assault a teenager who spurned his advances.

‘Dangerous’ Aaron Irvine was clad in black and carrying a knife and rope when he went to the girl’s home.

He has now been jailed for eight years and four months for the ‘planned’ attack in January.

Judge Barbara Mensah told him: ‘It’s quite clear you are a dangerous individual.’

‘You had an obsession with her and you were infatuated with her.’

Aaron Irvine was described by the judge as a dangerous individual (Picture: South Beds News Agency)

Irvine, from Bedford, was 18 when he went to the home where his victim lived with her family.

He wore a balaclava, latex black gloves and in a rucksack he had a hunting knife, length of rope, tape, a black utility belt, a shoe lace, wet wipes, a lock pick and a change of clothing.

The items he had with him that day were described by his victim in court as a ‘rape kit’ and she said she felt ‘revulsion, anger and fear.’

The court heard that Irvine first contacted the victim through social media in August 2018 and they had conversations about school and exams.

The day before the attack, he had sent the girl a Snapchat message asking if she had a boyfriend.

She said she was ‘out of a relationship’ and he replied ‘well, I’m known to be very good at making girls happy.’

The girl told the court she was ‘not comfortable’ with the response.

Irvine threatened the girls at knifepoint (Picture: South Beds News Agency)

In the afternoon of January 2, privately-educated Irvine drove to the girl’s home in Bedfordshire where she was watching TV with a friend.

Once inside the home, Irvine began caressing the girls at knifepoint and sexually touched the girl who had rebuffed him.

She pleaded with him to take any property he wanted but he told her ‘surely you just give me something in return.’

When her friend kicked him in the groin, the girls escaped.

His victim told the court: ‘He wanted to come to my house and rape me. It’s pretty clear, because when we left him he didn’t take anything. Nothing was missing.’

Irvine was dressed all in black and wore a balaclava (Picture: South Beds News Agency)

Irvine ran into nearby woods and changed clothing, but was arrested by police shortly afterwards.

Advertisement

Officers found a notebook in his bedroom, including one entry entitled ‘forced compliance.’

Irvine had claimed he only went to the house to scare the girl and said his choice of clothing was because he was ‘interested in the special forces.’

He admitted common assault and possessing an offensive weapon.

A jury found him guilty of trespass with intent to commit a sexual offence and sexual assault.

He was cleared of attempted rape.
